feed.title: Full-RBF Peering Bitcoin Core v25.1 Released

entry.title: Full-RBF Peering Bitcoin Core v25.1 Released
entry.summary:
Bitcoin Core v25.1 with Antoine Riard's full-rbf peering code is available on GitHub. This version includes some minor updates as well. The purpose of this version is to advertise a FULL_RBF service bit when mempoolfullrbf=1 is set and to connect to four additional FULL_RBF peers. These changes ensure that a core group of nodes are reliably propagating full-rbf replacements. It is not necessary for everyone to run this version, but it would be helpful if more people did.
Running full-rbf has its advantages, which are discussed in a blog post by Peter Todd: "Why You Should Run mempoolfullrbf." Currently, at least 31% of hash power from at least 4 mining pools is dedicated to mining full-RBF.
For more information and resources, you can visit the following links: - Bitcoin Core v25.1 with full-rbf peering code: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/petertodd/bitcoin/tree/full-rbf-v25.1) - Blog post by Peter Todd: [Why You Should Run mempoolfullrbf](https://petertodd.org/2023/why-you-should-run-mempoolfullrbf) - Full-RBF testing results: [Full-RBF Testing](https://petertodd.org/2023/fullrbf-testing) - Peter Todd's website: [Peter Todd](https://petertodd.org)
If you have any further questions or need assistance, you can contact Peter Todd at peter@petertodd.org.
